blocks.text: Q1 to Q5: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the word whose underlined part is pronounced differently from that of the rest in each of the following questions.
Q6 to Q30: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the following questions.
Q6: He didn't do it himself. He asked some workmen ……………….. it for him.
……………… they are native to tropical regions, some special of bamboo have adapted to temperate zones.
After a hard day of work, Dad was feeling very …………….. and tired.
"Sorry, I don't remember ……….. you here before."
OXFAM …………….. the Oxford Committee for Famine Relief.
"I ………………..  to see the doctor if I were you."
I wish my parents …………… here now.
My car is getting unreliable. I think I'll trade it ………………. for a new one.
I have two horses. ………… of them run very fast.
"You ……………. put the car in the garage. I'm going out in it later."
Swimming and water skiing are both ………………sports.
In some countries, each academic term is ………………by a week-long break.
The 22nd SEA Games was a successful …………… event.
Not only ……………the exam but she also got scholarship
……………! I had no idea you were abroad last month.
The noise was ………………it woke everyone up.
It is very important to make a good impression …………………your interviewer.
Who suggested …………… here for the picnic?
"I've enjoyed myself very much. But it's very late, so ……………….
No, it's nice to say so.
Yes, it's nice of you to say so.
- Mike: "Our living standards have been improved greatly."
The vice director is ……………… with the applicant’s enthusiasm.
Margaret did not remember what I …………….. her the day before.
I tried to solve the problem ……………. the noise and interruptions.
Q31 to Q35: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to show the underlines part that needs correction.
Q31: Our lifestyle changed since running water came to our village.
Neither plants or animals can survive for very long without water, a necessary resource that support all life forms.
Woman were denied the right to own property and participate in public life.
Thank to the help from UNICEF, many families in remote villages are able to live in sanitary conditions.
Books with good stories are often described like food for thought.
Q36 to Q40: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer for each of the blanks from 36 to 40.

When the weather is cold, it is not very much fun to (36) ______a bus. People have to stand at a bus-stop for minutes or even hours. They talk about the bus and (37)_______about the weather. Most of them feel cold. Some have to drink coffee to stay warm. Traveling by buses (38) _______pollution, but people often would rather drive their cars. Many people are not used to the bus schedules, and they do not like to wait. On the other hand, many people have been (39) ______the bus every day for many years. They are used to it. They say the bus has been coming on time every day, and they have never been late for work. In (40) _______, they do not need a parking place in all that time. Buses are very convenient when you are used to them.

Q41 to Q45: Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions from 41 to 45.

Fiction is the writing of a story or text that is not true. It can be written in the form of either poetry or prose. Poetry is a style of writing in which short lines form verses. Often, words at the end of these lines rhyme, like "bed" and "red." We call a group of verses about one subject a "poem." Prose writing does not have verses, nor does it rhyme. It uses sentences and paragraphs. Prose is used in magazine articles, newspaper stories, short stories, and books.

Prose fiction has existed since ancient times, but most early fiction was actually written as poetry. Scholars disagree about the date of the first prose fiction book, or novel. Some scholars classify fictional stories from ancient Greece and Rome as the earliest novels. Others claim there were novels in Asia as early as the 6th century. These early novels were mostly short adventure stories about fictional characters.

In Europe, prose fiction began to seriously challenge poetry in the 16th century. A Spanish author, Cervantes, wrote Europe's first prose novel in the early 1600s. However, longer novels, like Cervantes's Don Quixote, did not become very popular until the 1700s. By that time, there were more printing presses, and more people knew how to read. In addition, more people had money to buy these books. Today, the vast majority of fiction is written in prose rather than in poetry.
Q41: What does the word "It" in paragraph 1 refer to?
They are usually written in verse.
They are usually written in rhyme.
They are usually written in paragraphs.
They are usually written by scholars.
What can we learn about newspaper stories from paragraph 1?
The word "classify" in paragraph 2 is closest in meaning to ……………..
Prose fiction has been very popular since long ago.
Poetic fiction has not been around since ancient times.
The date of the earliest known novel is the sixteenth century.
The date of the earliest known novel is not easy to determine.
What can be inferred from the second paragraph?
when prose became dominant in Europe
when poetry became dominant in Europe
when Cervantes became an important author
The topic discussed in paragraph 3 is about …………………
